data.title: Shannon Rugby R.F.C.
data.meta_description: Join Shannon Rugby RFC. Your membership means so much to us. It allows us to provide you with the best experience available.
data.meta_site_name: Shannon Rugby R.F.C. - Alone it Stands
data.text:
Welcome to the 2024/25 Season,

Here is some information on renewing or becoming a member.

We are using Sportlomo an online platform directly linked to the Munster Branch/IRFU for membership registration. This will provide you with the best options to pay your membership conveniently and efficiently. Follow the below link to visit out Sportlomo membership registration page to join or renew your membership.

Here are some of key benefits that you and your family can benefit be being a member in such a great family club that is Shannon RFC:

Physical Benefits

Fitness and Health: Rugby is a physically demanding sport that promotes cardiovascular health, strength, and endurance. Regular participation can help children stay fit and healthy.

Coordination and Motor Skills: The sport requires agility, balance, and hand-eye coordination, helping children develop these essential skills.

Social Benefits

Teamwork: Rugby teaches the importance of working as a team. Children learn to rely on their teammates and understand the value of collaboration.

Friendships: Joining a club allows children to make new friends and build social connections outside of school.

Mental Benefits

Discipline and Focus: The structured environment of a rugby club helps instill discipline and concentration, both on and off the field.

Confidence: Learning new skills and being part of a team can significantly boost a childâ€™s self-esteem and confidence.

Life Skills

Resilience: Rugby can be tough, and children learn to cope with challenges and setbacks, fostering resilience.

Leadership: Opportunities to take on leadership roles, such as team captain, can help develop leadership qualities.

Enjoyment and Passion

Fun: Rugby is an exciting and fun sport that many children grow to love.

Passion for Sport: Being part of a club can ignite a lifelong passion for sports and an active lifestyle.

Community Involvement

Local Engagement: Joining a local club helps children feel connected to their community and promotes local pride.

Support Network: Families often get involved, creating a supportive environment for the children.

Opportunities

Competitions and Tournaments: Children get the chance to participate in local, regional, and sometimes national competitions.

Skill Development: Professional coaching helps children develop their skills to the best of their abilities.

Overall, joining a local rugby club can provide children with a well-rounded experience that benefits their physical, social, and emotional development.

Become a fully paid-up member of Shannon Rugby Football Club today.
